Name: Coptic textile
Description: A fragment of textile in wool and linen. The motif consists of a running wave border enclosing a hare between a huntsman and the traces of a second figure. The hunter is naked except for a 'chamlys'. The colours are indigo and natural.Technique: plain weave ground. Tapestry with built-up shapes, slits, curved wefts and 'soumak' outlining.Ends per inch (warp threads): 48.Picks per inch (weft threads): 32 over ground, 128 approximately over tapestry.
